question.title: How do Maven dependencies get added from parent and transitive dependencies
question.body:
In a Spring Boot application, I have included the 'reactor-netty-http' dependency version 1.2.5 in the POM.xml. The reactor-netty-http 1.2.5 depends on netty-common, netty-buffer, etc., with version 4.1.119. However, in the application, I can see that the dependencies netty-common and netty-buffer are showing version 4.1.116 instead of 4.1.119. The 4.1.116 version dependencies might be coming from another dependency in the POM that includes reactor-netty.

Below is mvn dependency:tree output:(which has 4.1.116)

[INFO] +- io.projectreactor.netty:reactor-netty-http:jar:1.2.5:compile
[INFO] |  +- io.netty:netty-codec-http:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- io.netty:netty-common:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- io.netty:netty-buffer:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- io.netty:netty-transport:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- io.netty:netty-codec:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  \- io.netty:netty-handler:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  +- io.netty:netty-codec-http2:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  +- io.netty:netty-resolver-dns:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- io.netty:netty-resolver:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  \- io.netty:netty-codec-dns:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  +- io.netty:netty-resolver-dns-native-macos:jar:osx-x86_64:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  \- io.netty:netty-resolver-dns-classes-macos:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  +- io.netty:netty-transport-native-epoll:jar:linux-x86_64:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  +- io.netty:netty-transport-native-unix-common:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |  \- io.netty:netty-transport-classes-epoll:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  +- io.projectreactor.netty:reactor-netty-core:jar:1.2.1:compile
[INFO] |  |  \- io.netty:netty-handler-proxy:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  |     \- io.netty:netty-codec-socks:jar:4.1.116.Final:compile
[INFO] |  \- io.projectreactor:reactor-core:jar:3.7.1:compile
[INFO] |     \- org.reactivestreams:reactive-streams:jar:1.0.4:compile

When I remove 'reactor-netty-http' from my POM, it does not show any reactor-netty dependencies in the dependency tree list. However, the 4.1.116 netty dependencies can still be seen when I execute mvn help:effective-pom, which means they must be coming from another dependency. My question is, why are they not seen in mvn dependency:tree?

And why does the 'reactor-netty-http' dependency version 1.2.5 show 4.1.116 jars, and not 4.1.119?

question_comments.body: Spring Boot itself manages a lot of dependency versions, including Netty, so depending on which Spring Boot version you're using, it might be defining a different version in its dependencyManagement than the one you're expecting.
Try using mvn dependency:tree -Dverbose=true or mvn dependency:tree -X, this will show which versions have been omitted because of conflicts.

Most likely because those libraries are also a dependency of another library or even direct by your project. I assume the shown dependency tree is incomplete. Look at the full version and search for netty-codec-http:jar. I assume you will find it more than once.
Thanks, got it.., why  'reactor-netty-http' dependency version 1.2.5 is showing 4.1.116 jars not 4.1.119?

Why should they be in dependency:tree if they aren't used. Spring Boot has explicit version management for certain libraries but that is dependency management (managing the version, excludes etc.) but not the actual inclusion.
